text: Is there a way to automatically create a page with HUBDB data when a new row is added?
yes, enable the dynamic pages option
check out this tutorial if you haven't seen it: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/how-to-build-dynamic-pages-with-hubdb>
Thanks <@U7V9DQ31P> that's exactly what I'm looking for

Alright... next question.  I'm wondering if it would be possible to create multiple dynamic pages from the same HUBDB.  Here's the use case I'm looking at:

Client is a wedding business.  They have a listing of wedding venues they work with that includes a .pdf file of the venue floor plan and they want that floor plan to be gated.  I want to use the HUBDB to create a website page for each venue, a landing page with a form for each venue, and then a thank you page with the floor plan .pdf for after a user has submitted the landing page form.

Think this could all be done from one DB?
it could but they won't all have pretty URLs. You'll have to stick some parameters in the URL for all but the main pages
there's no way to do custom routing in HubL/HubDB at least that I know of
Ah, ok.  Thanks for the help!  I think I'm going to avoid the whole issue by placing a form directly on the page with the fulfillment link included in an inline thank you message
Now if only there was a file select option in HubDB instead of just images
